page.title: 18Biography (cont)....
page.content: Presents for children were few, and often from shops such as the penny shop in Castleford. They recieced toys like wooden dolls, cars, fruit and pennies. Christmas dinner was big and mostly pork because local people often reaed pigs. Eggs were eaten as well, as hens were kept too. Families got together and children played games like ludo and snakes and ladders. Christmas trees were to be had, but instead mistltoe and oranges and apples were hung from hooks in the ceiling. The hats were little Tom o Shanters. Most of the people wore dark colours. Childrens best clothes were different, sailor suits for the boys and brown velvet dresses with a white pinafore for the girls they were all in fashion.
